intro: Psephellus maleevii, commonly known as the Caucasian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
